definition: abbr. for 維吾爾族|维吾尔族, Uighur (Uyghur) ethnic group of Xinjiang
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
race/nationality/ethnicity/clan/by extension, social group (e.g. office workers 上班族)

sentences.english: From the 1500s on, the Ewe were driven from the Niger River delta westwards.
sentences.chinese: 自1500年开始，伊维族便被迫由尼日河往西迁移。

sentences.english: Minority groups such as the Uyghurs complain that they are subjected to discrimination by the majority Han.
sentences.chinese: 但是维族人还是抱怨被汉族人歧视了。

sentences.english: Hans are China's ethnic majority, while a large population of ethnic Uighurs (pronounced WEE'-gurs) lives in Xinjiang.
sentences.chinese: 汉族是中国的主体民族，而新疆居住着大量的维族。

sentences.english: Exile groups have condemned the policy as an attempt to assimilate Uighurs into Han culture.
sentences.chinese: 流亡团体指责此政策企图同化维族。

sentences.english: Xinjiang is home to many Uyghurs.
sentences.chinese: 新疆是很多维族人的故乡。

sentences.english: Cambodia deports Uygurs back to China.
sentences.chinese: 柬埔寨将维族骚乱分子驱逐回中国。

sentences.english: Nine Uighurs have been sentenced to death over the fatal riots.
sentences.chinese: 已有九名维族人在血腥骚乱后被判处死刑。

definition: Hui Islamic ethnic group living across China
Russian ethnic group (of northeast China and Xinjiang etc)/Russian nationality/Russians (of Russia)
Tajik ethnic group/Tajikistan, former Soviet republic adjoining Xinjiang and Afghanistan
Hui person/member of Hui ethnic group living across China
